definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)

sentences.english: It exhorts to faith and courage.
The Chinese people faced this disaster with compassion and courage.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民用愛心和勇氣來面對這場災難。

sentences.english: None of it could have happened without off-the-charts courage.
sentences.chinese: 如果他沒有過人的勇氣，這一切都不可能發生。
邁克，我真佩服你的勇氣。

sentences.english: I really admire your courage in biting your toe nail in public.
sentences.chinese: 我真信服你敢於在平易近衆場所咬腳趾甲的勇氣。

sentences.english: Courage is going from failure to failure with-out losing enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 勇氣就是不斷失敗，而熱情仍在。

sentences.english: If you lack courage in love, your life will be colorless.
sentences.chinese: 一個在愛情中缺乏勇氣的人，生活也會平淡無味。

sentences.english: Have the courage to try, what thing also difficult.
sentences.chinese: 沒有勇氣不嘗試，啥事也難成啊。

sentences.english: Love really need courage to face the tattle and prate.
sentences.chinese: 愛真的需要勇氣，來面對流言蜚語。

sentences.english: I plucked up the courage to ask her out. She agreed.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我終於鼓起勇氣單獨約她出去。

sentences.english: She defeated the bad guy by virtue of her courage and by a pair of vices.
sentences.chinese: 由於她的勇氣和藉助一對老虎鉗，她打敗了那個壞蛋。

sentences.english: I admire him for having the strength and the courage to rebuild his life.
sentences.chinese: 我敬佩他那種爲重建人生而體現出的勇氣和毅力。

sentences.english: The observed randomness of free markets unnerves them.
sentences.chinese: 看到自由市場的無序性，讓他們失去勇氣。

sentences.english: E. g. Don't became dejected. Courage is the father of success.
sentences.chinese: 不要氣餒，勇氣是成功之父。

sentences.english: Many men have told stories of Old Clubfoot's courage.
sentences.chinese: 許多男人講故事的舊馬蹄內翻足的勇氣。

definition: determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
